benchmark_details.name: EXPERT LONG BENCH
benchmark_details.overview: EXPERT LONG BENCH is an expert-level benchmark containing 11 tasks from 9 domains that reflect realistic expert workflows and applications, designed to evaluate long-form outputs that adhere to domain-specific requirements.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a multi-disciplinary benchmark designed to evaluate the capabilities of large language models on real-world expert-level tasks that require long-form inputs and outputs, using expert-written references for grounded evaluation.

data.annotation: Manual annotations by domain experts, structured according to expert-designed rubrics.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on checklist-mapped evaluations of model outputs against expert references.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 and accuracy scores indicate better performance on complex, domain-specific tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Top-performing models evaluated against the expert-level benchmark include Gemini-2.0-Flash and GPT-4o.
methodology.validation: Validation is based on manual verification of model outputs matched to human-written references and expert-designed rubrics.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 for most datasets, with some datasets remaining private.
